intro: Calycolpus cochleatus, commonly known as the spiralwood, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its spiral arrangement of leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in umbels. The fruit is a dry capsule that contains several seeds, and the plant is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical environments.
